abstract: Qwest Communications, the Denver-based telecommunications provider, announced Monday it has decided to start reselling mobile phone service provided by Verizon Wireless. That means it will stop selling the mobile phone service that it currently provides over the Sprint/Nextel network. The development is more bad news for Sprint/Nextel, which has been fighting uphill since its $35 billion merger in 2005.

lead_paragraph: The turnip that is Sprint Nextel is giving a little more blood.

headline.main: Qwest Hangs Up on Sprint Nextel
